strings.Value: "I would like to personally express my gratitude for all your help."
"I stumbled into a most peculiar old man on my way here…"
"I just couldn't help not paying a visit, especially after your invitation."
"I see life in Varnhold is in full swing."
"You have my respects, Maegar, but I have to leave."
"Planning future conquests, are you?"
"I'm glad we see eye to eye on the issue."
"Whatever you say."
"Helping out competitors is a fool's errand."
[Nod at the merchant] "Taking the reins of government into your own hands?"
"Let me ask you directly — who else are you allied with?"
"I've just remembered a treasure hunter who was on his way to Tors of the Levenies. Have you heard of Willas Gunderson?"
"Valerie, it was a simple compliment."
[Say nothing]
"I hope the matter is closed."
"Valerie, compose yourself."

{n}Before you is a tall, robust man. A few white scars cross his face, his dark hair is gathered back in a small ponytail, and the sleeves of his expensive doublet do little to hide the muscles beneath. Although irritated by the argument, a wide smile lights up his face as he recognizes you.{/n}
"A pleasure to see you again, baron{mf||ess}!"
"Whom do I see! {name}, my friend! Welcome to {g|Varnhold}Varnhold{/g}! I am Maegar Varn, I run the town here. I hope you had no trouble on the roads?"
{n}Maegar laughs pleasantly.{/n} "Don't mention it, old friend! We adventurers help each other out, am I right?"

"Look at this from another perspective, my friend — this is a chance to survey your eastern borders and make sure you've got no one but allies here. It's better to see for yourself than to rely on my words alone, am I right?"

"Much remains to be done. What you see now is just the beginning. {g|Varnhold}Varnhold{/g} has a shining future, just you wait! By next year we'll begin building a tract to your capital, and establish river trade with {g|Restov}Restov{/g}."

"Right now, {g|Dunsward}Dunsward{/g} is not particularly welcoming, but I aim to change that. As soon as we get a foothold here, we'll begin clearing the land of creatures, monsters and spriggans alike. The people must feel safe."
"We've got enough on our hands at the moment! Although, in the future — who knows, who knows…"

{n}Maegar studies you for a moment in silence, then bursts into laughter.{/n} "Just don't think I'll start off by marching my guard over the mountains to your doorstep! There's plenty of land east for my people to patrol without tresspassing on my allies!"
"Hm? Ah, yes, you mean Cephal Lorentus, my wizard. Codger's hardly a pleasure to talk to, but when it comes to knowledge of the arcane, he's without match."

"Sometimes the locals bring me curious objects — they unearth them while plowing or stumble upon them while patrolling the wilderness. If the object looks interesting, I send them to Cephal — let him separate the wheat from the chaff."
"Is that so, baron{mf||ess}…? Well then, I'll note your opinion for the future."
"Treat your neighbor as you wish to be treated yourself — am I right?"
"That's why we get along so well, my friend!"
{n}Maegar grins.{/n} "Trying to, at least. I have to admit, conquering these lands was far easier than keeping the greedy merchants in check!"
{n}Maegar narrows his eyes at you, then nods.{/n} "Cutting to the chase, eh? Very well, we have more in common than you'd think…"

"Here's the truth — I don't trust those who sit in the north. They send fellows like us out to do all the dirty work. You and I share this frontier, {name}, and I'd rather bet on our mutual interest as neighbors than on the distant {g|Swordlords}Swordlords{/g} and their like."
"Ha, you bet! An energetic fellow, although a bit meddlesome. Luckily, he spends most of his time prowling about in search of imaginary treasure, and that keeps him occupied."
"Words of a worthy ruler."
"You sure about that? Watch yourself, because I'll be watching you!"
{n}{d|Varn}Varn{/d} jokingly lifts his hands into the air.{/n} "Peace, peace!"
"Oh! What a fair lady has accompanied you! It's a pleasure to meet you. Such beauty is a rarity, especially in these harsh lands." {n}{d|Varn}Varn{/d} attempts to kiss Valerie's hand.{/n}
{n}Wincing, Valerie slips her hand from {d|Varn}Varn{/d}'s fingers.{/n} "Please keep your uncalled-for compliments to yourself, sir."
"My apologies! I meant no offense."
{n}Regongar looks at {d|Varn}Varn{/d} with a lecherous grin.{/n} "Nice muscles... How about meeting this evening to share a drink or two, hmm?"
"Ha ha ha! Sorry, lad, I don't swing that way. But I'm always up for a drink!"
"Apology accepted." {n}Valerie looks away.{/n}
{n}Maegar awkwardly shifts from foot to foot and clears his throat.{/n}
"Yes. Just like hundreds of other 'simple compliments' I hear day after day from everyone — be they lords or vagrants." {n}Valerie gives you a sullen look.{/n}
"Please, accept my sincere apologies once more! Let us change the subject."
"And my respect to you, lady..." {n}{d|Varn}Varn{/d} stops when Valerie, upon hearing his voice, turns around.{/n}
"Please have the decency not to stare at me, sir!"
{n}Valerie doesn't even dignify you with a look — she keeps staring off into the distance.{/n}
{n}Valerie sneaks a guilty look at you and Maegar.{/n} "Forgive me, {mf|sirs|lady, sir}. I am... a touch moody today."
"Oh, so there's only one 'fair lady' here? All right, fine... I'll be the evil and unpredictable one, who burns down random houses and picket fences..."
"I know the story of spriggans. They're dangerous, but miserable creatures in a way. Is it really necessary to exterminate them to live in peace and happiness?"
